body: The API doesn't provide a way for clients to verify the validity of a ToxID, including checksum computation. To not make every client do it's own implementation, there should be a public function to do it.

comment_data.body:
This is already done by toxcore I guess so it should be fairly easy to do. As I see it, we would just have to expose the function to the public API.

@GrayHatter @zetok I assigned u' as I believe you have more knoweldges than me on this topic.
I don't think toxcore should expose a function for every couple of lines of code that it has. Calculating the checksum is very straightforward.
@Impyy This would avoid clients dev to write their own implementations of stuff that are tied to core. I'm not for exposing useless things, but this might be a nice idea.
@Impyy the point is, the clients shouldn't have to care about the concrete algorithm to calculate the checksum. What if it changes one day?
@Impyy It would be useful for ie. copying entire ToxID by custom packets, we could just request the contact nospam and compute the checksum to verify that the received value is correct.

@sudden6 Should toxcore take over the other things every client needs to implement as well? I don't think so. To me, it would make more sense to implement these things in a separate higher level library. For instance, SharpTox will validate the checksum for you.

What toxcore really needs is a clear definition of what its responsibilities are, and of what should be left up to clients. To illustrate that, consider this: Maybe toxcore shouldn't be aware of the checksum at all. Clients could just pass the public key and the nospam directly to toxcore, instead of passing a Tox ID.
I kind of like the idea of passing nospam directly.

labels.description: New feature for the user, not a new feature for build script
labels.name: enhancement

title: Add a way to verify ToxIDs
